greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A253560(A253883(n)) = A122111((2*A122111(n)) - 1).
comment: Conjugate the partition defined by the prime factorization of n (see, e.g., table A112798 or A241918), resulting k = A122111(n), then take the k-th odd number (2k-1), and conjugate again, giving a(n) = A122111(2k-1).
Thus after a(1)=1, this is a permutation of A070003 (numbers divisible by the square of their largest prime factor).
When A122111 is represented as a binary tree, then node A122111(t > 1) = n has as its left child A122111(2t-1) = a(n).
xref: Cf. A070003 (same sequence without 1, sorted into ascending order).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 17 2015
